1a: ^... and that's what we do to traitors. I will have complete discipline in my kitchen until the Director restores order to the camp. Anyone who speaks out of turn again will get what Pan here got thrice over.
^Now lets get a head count. At a glance, we look light. Where's Imre?
^I'm right here, and I've brought friends. Your time's up, Kende. We're not taking orders from you anymore!

s: ^I will only give this offer once. Any guard who surrenders will be taken into custody under my protection. Those that resist, perish.
^That's right. I've come to fulfill my promise to the unbranded. Your servitude ends today!
^Quake, slaver! Today you and your guards get the blade!
^I care not for your grudges. I'm here to kill slavers, so lets get on with it.

1b: ^*The guard throws down his weapons.* I surrender!
^Gods, I'm surrounded by traitors. The next one of you who shows cowardice goes in the stew! I swear it!
1c: ^I see that this treachery has been festering for a while now. Listen up! Any slave that remains loyal to the Director will be given a week's reprieve after the revolt is put down. Any who side with the traitors will be flogged, branded, and then flogged again. To arms!
1d: ^So what if you have the numbers. I am on the side of the Gods and the right! From where I'm standing, all this means is less mouths to feed.

^Listen up! Any slave that remains loyal to the Director will be given a week's reprieve after the revolt is put down. Any who side with the traitors will be flogged, branded, and then flogged again. To arms!
1e: ^Imre, you pathetic layabout. All you've done is bring the brand down on you and your friends.

^Listen up! Any slave that remains loyal to the Director will be given a week's reprieve after the revolt is put down. Any who side with the traitors will be flogged, branded, and then flogged again. To arms!
2a: ^I've brought them, sir! This is the one I told you about!
^Excellent. And thanks to your warning, we're ready for them. Everyone gets double rations after this is over, thanks to Imre's loyalty. But first, stand fast. The traitors come!

s: ^Imre, you snake. Why would you betray us like this?
^I see this was a trap. No matter, we'll sweep aside all obstacles on the way to the Director! <Combat>

2b: ^Betrayal? You threatened me! You just wanted more fodder against the guards. At least this way I'll get to live to see freedom one day.

b: ^If it isn't the scum that insulted my cooking. I wonder if you'll be so mouthy after I've spitted and roasted you infront of your companions.
^The branded have breached the barricades, and now they've entered my kitchens? Don't come any closer, or you'll get scum on the pots!

s: ^It's not too late to surrender. If you throw down your weapons, we'll keep you safe in our custody until the fighting is over.
^Any of you nonbranded who decides to fight for your freedom will have it. We have no quarrel that you do not cause. <Cha
^If you nonbranded stay very still while I peel this cook, I may forget about you. Maybe. <Str
^Quake, slaver! Today you and your guards get the blade!
^I take no pleasure in it, but if you want to get in my way then you'll force me to remove you.

3b: ^I've cooked turnips tougher than you. When this is over, you'll just be more scraps on my kitchen's floor.
3c: ^Don't make me laugh, you couldn't pluck feathers from a duck.
3d: ^I'm not dying for you, Kende. My years of fixing your slop are at an end!
^Woah, hold on now. Can't we talk about this? Guys?
3f: ^*The guard throws down his weapons.* I surrender!
^Gods, I'm surrounded by traitors. The next one of you who shows cowardice goes in the stew! I swear it!
